senses.de: Regular action done by a person
senses.ex: Brushing my teeth after breakfast is my daily habit.

Tips.title: Context Matters
Tips.description: Understand when and where to use 'habit' by observing the context it's used in.
Tips.example: She made a habit of jogging before dawn, enjoying the quiet streets.

Tips.title: Positive or Negative
Tips.description: 'Habit' can refer to good or bad patterns, focus on adjectives for clarity.
Tips.example: His habit of leaving lights on is wasteful, unlike his habit of recycling.

senses.ex: He had a habit of smoking.

Tips.title: Addiction Reference
Tips.description: When 'habit' means addiction, it often implies a challenging behavior to overcome.
Tips.example: Her habit of biting her nails was difficult to break.

Tips.title: Negative Connotation
Tips.description: This sense of 'habit' usually has a negative connotation, unlike 'routine' or 'practice'.
Tips.example: His gambling habit worried his family.

senses.de: Dress or clothing of a particular kind
senses.ex: The monks wore a brown habit.

Tips.title: Specialized Usage
Tips.description: This outdated meaning is rarely used, be mindful of the context, often historical or religious.
Tips.example: In historical dramas, you may hear about the 'habit' a character wears.

Tips.title: Clothing Context
Tips.description: Knowing this meaning helps understanding of older texts or specific conversations.
Tips.example: The painting depicted a knight shedding his battle 'habit' for a robe.

senses.ex: The bush has a sprawling habit.

Tips.title: Botanical Feature
Tips.description: In botany, 'habit' is a technical term describing how a plant grows or appears.
Tips.example: This plant has an upright habit, making it ideal for narrow spaces.

Tips.title: Academic Language
Tips.description: Usually found in scientific texts; knowing this can help with academic reading.
Tips.example: Botanists have categorized the different 'habits' of various fern species.

Addiction.wordDefinition:
Addiction refers to a strong dependence on something, often a substance like drugs or alcohol.

Addiction can completely take over someone's life and cause serious physical and mental health problems.

It's much more difficult to break an addiction than it is to break a habit.

In summary, habits are regular behaviors that can be changed easily, while addictions are a serious dependence on something that can be detrimental to one's health and much harder to overcome.

Custom.wordDefinition:
Customs are commonly accepted practices or traditions that are unique to a particular group or society. They reflect the values, beliefs, and cultural norms of that group.

Some examples of customs include greeting someone with a handshake or bow, wearing specific clothing for religious ceremonies, or celebrating holidays in a particular way.

In summary, customs are shared practices that reflect the values of a group, while habits are individual routines or behaviors.

Customs are applicable within a particular social or cultural context, while habits can be applied by anyone regardless of their group or society.

Dependence.wordDefinition:
Dependence is when someone needs something in order to function or feel normal. For example, if someone is dependent on a medication to manage their chronic pain, they will experience withdrawal symptoms and have difficulty functioning if they stop taking the medication.

While both dependence and habits involve repeated behavior, the difference lies in the necessity and impact of the behavior.

Habits can be positive or negative, but dependence is typically seen as negative because it means someone relies on something outside of themselves to function.

Fixation.wordDefinition:
Fixation refers to an obsessive or unhealthy attachment to something or someone, while a habit refers to a regular or repeated behavior that is done without much conscious thought.

For example, if someone has a fixation with cleanliness, they may feel compelled to constantly clean and disinfect everything around them to the point where it becomes excessive and harmful.

Fixation is usually seen as negative and can have harmful effects on a person's life, while habits can be either positive or negative depending on what the behavior is.

Mannerism.wordDefinition:
A mannerism is a distinctive behavior or gesture that someone does, often unconsciously, that is characteristic of them.

For example, biting one's nails is a habit, as it is something that is done repeatedly without conscious thought. Twirling one's hair is a mannerism, as it is a distinctive behavior that is characteristic of an individual.

Habits can be positive or negative, while mannerisms are neither good nor bad. A person's habits can be changed with effort, while mannerisms are more difficult to change as they often occur unconsciously.

Both words are applicable in describing human behavior, but habits are generally more ingrained and have a greater impact on a person's life, while mannerisms are more superficial and less significant.

Pattern.wordDefinition:
A pattern is a repeated arrangement of something, such as a sequence of events or a design. For example, a weather pattern refers to the way that weather conditions repeat themselves over time.

Patterns can be observed in many different areas, from math and science to art and music.

While habits and patterns both involve repetition, habits refer specifically to behaviors or actions, while patterns can refer to any type of repeated arrangement.

Habits are applicable in our daily lives and are often used to describe personal routines, while patterns can be applicable in many different fields, from science to fashion.

Practice.wordDefinition:
Practice describes something that we intentionally do repeatedly in order to improve or become better at it.

For example, practicing playing an instrument or practicing a sport. Practice requires effort and intention.

To summarize, a habit is a behavior that we do without thinking about it, while practicing is intentionally repeating a task in order to improve.

Habits are usually daily routines, whereas practicing happens on a scheduled and focused time.

Routine.wordDefinition:
Routine refers to a set of actions or behaviors that are done deliberately and with intention, often in a specific order or pattern.

For example, your morning routine might involve waking up at a certain time, brushing your teeth, taking a shower, and getting dressed in a particular order.

Both habits and routines can be helpful or harmful depending on what they are and how often they are done.

It's important to be aware of the habits and routines in your life so that you can make choices that support your health and wellbeing.

quotes.Text: One of the most basic factors in sports is that winning becomes a habit, and losing is the same way. When failure starts to feel normal in your life or your work or even your darkest vices, you won't have to go looking for trouble, because trouble will find you. Count on it.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.Text: When we meet real tragedy in life, we can react in two ways - either by losing hope and falling into self-destructive habits, or by using the challenge to find our inner strength. Thanks to the teachings of Buddha, I have been able to take this second way.
quotes.Title: Tibetan Leader
quotes.Name: Dalai Lama

quotes.Text: You have to have really wide reading habits and pay attention to the news and just everything that's going on in the world: you need to. If you get this right, then the writing is a piece of cake.
quotes.Title: English Author
quotes.Name: Terry Pratchett

quotes.Text: Habit is a second nature that destroys the first. But what is nature? Why is habit not natural? I am very much afraid that nature itself is only a first habit, just as habit is a second nature.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Blaise Pascal

quotes.Text: Any book that helps a child to form a habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Maya Angelou

quotes.Text: You leave old habits behind by starting out with the thought, 'I release the need for this in my life'.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Wayne Dyer

quotes.Text: The world has the habit of making room for the man whose actions show that he knows where he is going.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Napoleon Hill

quotes.Text: When it comes to our everyday habits, it's important to ask: 'Am I putting God first?
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: Vices are often habits rather than passions.
quotes.Title: French Journalist
quotes.Name: Antoine Rivarol

quotes.Text: Character is simply habit long continued.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Plutarch
